monogr.title: The Catholicos of the East and His People, Being the Impressions of Five Years’ Work in the “Archbishop of Canterbury’s Assyrian Mission;” an Account of the Religious and Secular Life and Opinions of the Eastern Syrian Christians of Kurdistan and Northern Persia (Known also as Nestorians)

body.bibl: Maclean, Arthur John, and William Henry Browne. The Catholicos of the East and His People, Being the Impressions of Five Years’ Work in the “Archbishop of Canterbury’s Assyrian Mission;” an Account of the Religious and Secular Life and Opinions of the Eastern Syrian Christians of Kurdistan and Northern Persia (Known Also as Nestorians). London: Society for Promoting Christian Knowledge, 1892.

Arthur John Maclean and William Henry Browne, The Catholicos of the East and His People, Being the Impressions of Five Years’ Work in the “Archbishop of Canterbury’s Assyrian Mission; an Account of the Religious and Secular Life and Opinions of the Eastern Syrian Christians of Kurdistan and Northern Persia (Known Also as Nestorians) (London: Society for Promoting Christian Knowledge, 1892).
